title: So Riot, are we going to completely revise what stands for "zero tolerance" now?
body:
If I tell a single person to kill themselves I'm looking at a 14 day ban minimum. If I insult someone based on their race/gender/sexuality/religion, I'm looking at the same. But when your own employee tells that to thousands of your players, he's not getting even a slap on the wrist. Not even being forced into a half-assed apology.

If this asshat keeps his job even a day longer, you might as well unban each and every account locked away because of hate speech or encouraging suicide. And before any overzealous mod locks this for "witch hunting": I'm not directly saying that someone should be fired. I'm just saying that someone working at Riot is happily spewing words they consider unacceptable at the vast majority of their player base and getting away scot-free. How does that reflect on Riot's image, reputation and overall integrity?

He would not be getting fired because of his opinions only .No, he'd be fired because his publicly voiced opinions are alienating Riot's customers.

Riot is a company first, and company's goals is making profits. They shouldn't even care for the context - if you have an employee attacking and insulting your customers for whatever reason, that reflects upon your profits and reputation. From a purely business perspective, he should be let go.

For example, imagine if a pub had a bartender who happens to be racist. So, if he "voiced his opinion" by calling every black customer that enters the pub a "dumb n**ger* he'd most certainly be fired - because if he isn't, people of color would stop visiting the pub altogether and it'd garner a reputation for racism. In this case the bartender isn't fired because of his opinions as such, but rather because of the real, material consequences his publicly-voiced opinion caused to their employer.

"Free speech" isn't some magical protection that allows you to spew whatever toxic bullcrap you like without any consequences. If you insult a person based on their race/sexuality/religion/whatever are they violating your right of free speech by reacting negatively? If you are causing your employer loss of profits and face are they violating your right of free speech by doing damage control?

And as for "funny af", that is subjective. Suicide is one of things that should absolutely not be joked about in 99.99% of situations, and saying what boils down to "everyone who disagrees with my sexist bullcrap can go and off themselves". I fail to see how that comes even close to a funny joke.
